bibl.title: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, February 26, 1907

div1.p: Von Mansfelde comments on the work of Lazear and Carroll regarding the Yellow Fever Commission. He believes that Mabel Lazear and James Carroll should receive the same pension as Emilie Lawrence Reed.

div1.head: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, February 26, 1907
div1.opener:
NEBRASKA STATE MEDICAL ASSOCIATION

W. D. SHIELDS, Holdrege
GEO. H. BRASH, Beatrice
A. F. JONAS, Prest. N. S. M. A., Omaha
A. D. WILKINSON, Sec'y, N. S. M. A., Lincoln
A. S. v. MANSFELDE, Chairman, Ashland
No. {2425} Ashland Nebr. Febr. 26th 1907.
Mrs Mabel Lazear
Pasadena, Cal.
Dear Mrs Lazear:
div1.p:
In your lines of February 14th you
say that you “telegraphed me today”, did you?
If so I never received a telegram from you,
please inquire into this. I am surgeon of the
Chicago Burlington & Quincy Railroad and I am
connected with the depot and telegraph office by
two telephone systems, so could not lose a
message here.

In your last letter, received only last night,
You give me some valuable information; but I
still miss the letter Dr. Carroll wrote you immediate-
ly after Dr Lazears death, if I remember rightly
he wrote you at your request.

You say that you do not yet quite under-
stand just what I want and what for.

A careful reading of what has
been written about the Yellow fever Commission,
as judged from a medical stand point, leaves the
impression, and it has so affected the general
public not only, but the medical profession as
well, that the head of the Commission, was not
only the appointed head, but the head that con-
ceived every move, every experiment and also
the head, which succumbed at Cuba, just as
your husband real ly did, and the only one, to
the experiments there conducted, and as a neces-
sary corrallery, the other members were only
tools, admitted by good tools, but only that
and nothing more. Now, if your husband and
Dr. Reed had lived, nothing would be easier
than the establishment of each ones share
in the great work, and there is enough of it
to go around; but both bring dead, and Dr
Carroll not bring permitted by the code
of accepted morals to say one word, which
would or could take away from the credit, al-
ready bestowed upon Dr Walter Reed, nothing
remains but antemortem statements and
records to prove that Drs Lazear and Dr
James Carroll did not only more then mecha-
nical work, but really are the only ones of
that commission, who suffered and died to
prove that Dr Carlos Finlays contention, that
the mosquito is the conveyor of Yellow fever;

No._______________
and even this claim, absolutely true as far as
Dr. Carlos Finlay is concerned, and he is living,
is claimed for Dr Walter Reed in the United
States by many physicians and by the public
at large, though vehemently repudiated in
Cuba, and rightly so. Even William S
Thayer, who should have known better, says in one
of the pamphlets, sent me by you in your last
letter “The investigations of the Commission led
the members to the belief that a certain form
of mosquito played an important part in
the transmission of the poison of yellow fever.”

When the facts are that your husband over his
own signature says: that he received the eggs
of the very mosquito, which is the cause of the
conveyance of yellow fever to man, then known
as “Culex fasciatus”, but afterwards named
Stegomeya fasciata, from Dr. Carlos Finlay
himself, that he hatched those very eggs and
used them in his experiments.

I quote this so easily disproven misstatement, made
by those near to the whole investigation, to show you
how excusable the profession at large was and
the general public more so, when Dr Reed got
all the credit and Lazear and Carroll none,
except some pretty, pretty words, which are cheap
commodities in the marts of the world, how-
ever pleasant they made sound to interested
ears. at least

Now, as Dr. Howard A Kelly fears so dread-
fully, I am not going to pull Dr. Walter Reed
down from his monument by word or deed;
but I am going to see to it, if I live, and
I am grey haired now (61 years old) that Dr
Jesse William Lazear and Dr. James Carroll
go unto that same monument with Dr
Walter Reed; and if Reeds widow can get
125 dollars pension a month, when she does
not need it, I am going to find out how
much Carrolls and Lazears wife and
widow and their children get under the
rule of fair play, to which we Westerners
subscribe, when they do need it.

A. F. JONAS, Prest. N. S. M. A., Omaha
A. D. WILKINSON, Sec'y, N. S. M. A., Lincoln
A. S. v. MANSFELDE, Chairman, Ashland

That is were my “disinterestedness” comes in.
I am engaged as chairman of that committee
to see to it that “Suum cuique” (see the
devise in the seal above which means that
“give each one his due” and do adopted by
the Nebraska State Medical Association, because
it is my devise they think they owe me honor
when I have long since received more from them
than I ever deserved). If in the pursuit of
this my life work, you and your children
come to your own, I am sure it will make
me happy; but primarily I am fighting for
the honor due the dead hero and the living
one, both members of my loved profession
And this fight is to be a clean one; so
you need not fear to give me such data
as will bring & success to our common cause.
div1.closer: Very respectfully and sincerely yours ASvMansfelde.
